TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit AspNetCompatibilityRequirementsAttribute extends System.Attribute implements class System.ServiceModel.Description.IServiceBehavior

Docs.summary: Applied to a [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/indigo1-md.md)] service to indicate whether that service can be run in [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/add/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility code.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When applied to a service implementation class, this attribute indicates whether this service requires or supports [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/add/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility mode to be enabled for the hosting application domain (AppDomain).
AppDomains hosting [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/indigo2-md.md)] services can run in two different hosting modes:
- Mixed Transports Mode (Default): In this mode, [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/indigo2-md.md)] services do not participate in the [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/add/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] HTTP pipeline. This guarantees that a [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/indigo2-md.md)] service behaves consistently, independent of hosting environment and transport.
- [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/add/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] Compatibility Mode: In this mode, [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/indigo2-md.md)] services participate in the [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/add/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] HTTP pipeline in a manner similar to ASMX services. [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/add/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] features such as File Authorization, UrlAuthorization, and HTTP Session State are applicable to [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/indigo2-md.md)] services running in this mode.
The hosting mode is controlled by the application-level configuration flag `aspNetCompatibilityEnabled`.
`<system.serviceModel>`
`<serviceHostingEnvironment aspNetCompatibilityEnabled="true"/>`
`</system.serviceModel>`
This flag is `false` by default and thus [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/indigo2-md.md)] services run in the Mixed Transports Mode unless you explicitly opt into the [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/add/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility mode.
[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/add/includes/crabout-md.md)] [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/add/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility mode, see [\<serviceHostingEnvironment>](../Topic/%3CserviceHostingEnvironment%3E.md).
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activation.AspNetCompatibilityRequirementsAttribute.RequirementsMode%2A> property to do this. At runtime, applications can detect if [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/add/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility mode is enabled by checking the value of the static property <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostingEnvironment.AspNetCompatibilityEnabled%2A>.
## Examples Service developers can ensure that their service is only run in ASP.NET Compatibility Mode by setting the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activation.AspNetCompatibilityRequirementsAttribute.RequirementsMode%2A> property on the AspNetCompatibilityRequirementsAttribute to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activation.AspNetCompatibilityRequirementsMode> as shown in the following example
[!code-vb[S_AspNetCompatibility#1](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.servicemodel.ac_20_1.vb)] [!code-cs[S_AspNetCompatibility#1](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.servicemodel.ac_20_1.cs)]
[!code-vb[S_AspNetCompatibility#2](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.servicemodel.ac_20_2.vb)] [!code-cs[S_AspNetCompatibility#2](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.servicemodel.ac_20_2.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets the level of [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/add/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility required by the service.
Docs.value: The that indicates the services required degree of [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/add/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the RequirementsMode property to set the hosting mode in code. This can also be done by setting an application-level configuration flag `aspNetCompatibilityEnabled`. [!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/add/includes/crdefault-md.md)][\<serviceHostingEnvironment>](../Topic/%3CserviceHostingEnvironment%3E.md).
At runtime, applications can detect whether [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/add/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility mode is enabled by checking the value of the static property <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostingEnvironment.AspNetCompatibilityEnabled%2A>.
## Examples [!code-vb[S_AspNetCompatibility#2](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/a589b30d-4c2b-4f8e-adf5-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[S_AspNetCompatibility#2](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/a589b30d-4c2b-4f8e-adf5-_1.cs)]

Docs.exception: The value is not a valid one for the .

MemberSignature.Value: void IServiceBehavior.AddBindingParameters (System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription description, System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase serviceHostBase, System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> endpoints, System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingParameterCollection parameters);

.method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.ServiceModel.Description.IServiceBehavior.AddBindingParameters(class System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription description, class System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase serviceHostBase, class System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1<class System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> endpoints, class System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingParameterCollection parameters) cil managed

Docs.param: The used to host the service.
The <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601> of type <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> that contains the endpoints for the service.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingParameterCollection> that contains the parameters that the binding elements for the service can access.
Docs.summary: Adds custom data that the binding elements can access to support the implementation of the contract.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method supports the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/indigo2-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

Docs.summary: Checks that the type of hosting is consistent with the [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/add/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility requirements.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method supports the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/indigo2-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

Docs.exception: The service hosting is not compatible with the [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/add/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility requirements.
